j_dawes

About

About

I am a graphic designer and photographer based in Leeds, UK.

In both print and digital, I have created a variety of work for a diverse array of clients ranging from sport campaigns to bespoke publication printing. Inspired by peers and colleagues, and having worked both in-house and as a freelancer, I have curated an illustrious portfolio over the period of half a decade.

Being passionate about the physical arts as much as the visual, voice over artistry is a newfound branch to my ever-extending creative outlet.

(Voiceover work coming soon to Dawes)

Please feel free to contact me via email where we can chat about commissions and collaborations!

Johnathan

A Concrete JUNGLE.

A Concrete JUNGLE.

Ongoing project about the setting and architectural complex of Leeds University. Set in concrete, the university has sat in Leeds for over 60 decades and has matured over the years into somewhat a spectacle.

This publication will follow the architects that created Leeds University and the people who live and work around it.

Editorial, Photography, Print.

Leeds University, 53°48’19.3”N 1°33’16.7”W

BIRD FISH & ROOT

BIRD FISH &
ROOT

Self initiated piece for a visual identity of a Korean restaurant in the middle of Soho, London.

Visual Identity, photography.

THE SENIOR OPEN

THE SENIOR
OPEN

Campaign for the 2019 European Tours event, The Senior Open, whilst working at The Lift Agency.

The Senior Open is a professional golf tournament for players aged 50 and over. It is run by The R&A, the same body that organises The Open Championship.

Identity, Artworking, Print & Editorial.

Client - The European Tour whilst working with The Lift Agency.

https://www.theliftagency.com

FUND OUR FUN

FUND OUR
FUN

Collaboration with VICE.

Photographs taken in and around Leeds of music venues that have been closed for several years. VICE analysis, in collaboration with Music Venue Trust, reveals that there have been 154 closures and 390 venues at risk since 2016 in the UK. A map of venue locations has been put together to create awareness and discussion of venues that are closing or are closed.

Photography, Identity, Editorial.

Client - VICE

https://fundourfun.vice.com

A BOXAND SOME HEAT

A BOX AND SOME HEAT

A rare sighting of a hot air balloon drifting over Leeds on a summer’s evening.

Photography

A KITCHEN GARDEN IN TUFNELL PARK.

A
KITCHEN
GARDEN
INTUFNELL
PARK.

A 250 page publication designed and printed to a very high standard. It follows a gardener who discovered and built his own kitchen garden in the middle of London, documenting it from the start to its end.

Kitchen gardens were once scattered all over Britain, many have been either lost to the plough, or in this case, kept and preserved and then eventually brought back to life. The clients love for gardening and horticulture saved this particular kitchen garden.

Art Direction, Print Management, Editorial, Photography & Identity.

Client - William Grout Garden Design, London

51°33’17.2”N 0°07’41.6”W

A FORCE OF NATURE

A
FORCE
OF NATURE

Aysgarth Falls are a triple flight of waterfalls, surrounded by woodland and farmland, carved out by the River Ure over an almost one-mile stretch on its descent to mid-Wensleydale in the Yorkshire Dales of England, near the village of Aysgarth.

The falls are quite spectacular after heavy rainfall as thousands of gallons of water cascade over the series of broad limestone steps, which are divided into three stages: upper force, middle force and lower force.

Here are some photographs of the force in action.

Powerful stuff.

Aysgarth Falls, 54.2945° N, 1.9834° W

KEIGHLEY VALLEY RAILWAY

KEIGHLEY
VALLEY
RAILWAY

The Keighley & Worth Valley Railway is a preserved standard gauge line which joins the national railway network at Keighley and runs 5-miles up the valleys of the River Worth and Bridgehouse Beck to Oxenhope.

Perhaps most famous for its role in the 1970 film version of Edith Nesbit’s story The Railway Children.

Photography

Haworth Railway station, 53.831092, -1.948768

FREEDOM

Illustration, Branding

https://wearegolden.co.uk

THE BMW

THE BMW

Artworking and social media design work for the 2019 BMW PGA Championship hosted by the European Tour.

The BMW Championship is a professional golf tournament which is the penultimate FedEx Cup playoff event on the PGA tour schedule. Introduced in 2007, the BMW Championship was previously known as the Western Open.

Artworking, Social Media design.

Client - The European Tour whilst working with The Lift Agency.

https://www.theliftagency.com

BARCELONA

Barcelona photographed in 2018. A city by the sea yet encircled by wooded mountains, with gorgeous architecture, beautiful churches, and a pedestrian thoroughfare

Photography

New York I LOVE YOU.

New York
I LOVE YOU.

Photographs of New York City after visiting there in 2016. Being in New York City itself was all too surreal, like a dream come true. Buildings raced each other in a quest to touch the soft blue sky and people littered the streets and sidewalks. Life there was upbeat and fast-paced, everyone and everything was moving.

Photography

40.7484° N, 73.9857° W

RACETO THE TOP

RACE TO
THE TOP

Photographs from the 2018 classic and vintage Hillclimb.

Photography

53.903476, -1.488106

DANCE

DANCE

End of year show for Leeds College of Art back in 2016.

I have always had an admiration for architecture, buildings are predominately the subject of my photography. This piece was inspired by that passion combined with an interest in dystopian landscapes.

Photography, Digital and Screen Printing.

https://www.leeds-art.ac.uk
